00038 #ifndef PMEMOBJ_TIMED_MUTEX_HPP
00039 #define PMEMOBJ_TIMED_MUTEX_HPP
00040 
00041 #include <chrono>
00042 
00043 #include "libpmemobj++/detail/conversions.hpp"
00044 #include "libpmemobj/thread.h"
00045 
00046 namespace nvml
00047 {
00048 
00049 namespace obj
00050 {
00051 
00061 class timed_mutex {
00062         typedef std::chrono::system_clock clock_type;
00063 
00064 public:
00066         typedef PMEMmutex *native_handle_type;
00067 
00071         timed_mutex() noexcept = default;
00072 
00076         ~timed_mutex() = default;
00077 
00089         void
00090         lock()
00091         {
00092                 PMEMobjpool *pop = pmemobj_pool_by_ptr(this);
00093                 if (int ret = pmemobj_mutex_lock(pop, &this->plock))
00094                         throw lock_error(ret, std::system_category(),
00095                                          "Failed to lock a mutex.");
00096         }
00097 
00112         bool
00113         try_lock()
00114         {
00115                 PMEMobjpool *pop = pmemobj_pool_by_ptr(this);
00116                 int ret = pmemobj_mutex_trylock(pop, &this->plock);
00117 
00118                 if (ret == 0)
00119                         return true;
00120                 else if (ret == EBUSY)
00121                         return false;
00122                 else
00123                         throw lock_error(ret, std::system_category(),
00124                                          "Failed to lock a mutex.");
00125         }
00126 
00144         template <typename Clock, typename Duration>
00145         bool
00146         try_lock_until(
00147                 const std::chrono::time_point<Clock, Duration> &timeout_time)
00148         {
00149                 return timedlock_impl(timeout_time);
00150         }
00151 
00169         template <typename Rep, typename Period>
00170         bool
00171         try_lock_for(const std::chrono::duration<Rep, Period> &timeout_duration)
00172         {
00173                 return timedlock_impl(clock_type::now() + timeout_duration);
00174         }
00175 
00187         void
00188         unlock()
00189         {
00190                 PMEMobjpool *pop = pmemobj_pool_by_ptr(this);
00191                 if (int ret = pmemobj_mutex_unlock(pop, &this->plock))
00192                         throw lock_error(ret, std::system_category(),
00193                                          "Failed to unlock a mutex.");
00194         }
00195 
00201         native_handle_type
00202         native_handle() noexcept
00203         {
00204                 return &this->plock;
00205         }
00206 
00210         timed_mutex &operator=(const timed_mutex &) = delete;
00211 
00215         timed_mutex(const timed_mutex &) = delete;
00216 
00217 private:
00221         template <typename Clock, typename Duration>
00222         bool
00223         timedlock_impl(const std::chrono::time_point<Clock, Duration> &abs_time)
00224         {
00225                 PMEMobjpool *pop = pmemobj_pool_by_ptr(this);
00226 
00227                 /* convert to my clock */
00228                 const typename Clock::time_point their_now = Clock::now();
00229                 const clock_type::time_point my_now = clock_type::now();
00230                 const auto delta = abs_time - their_now;
00231                 const auto my_abs = my_now + delta;
00232 
00233                 struct timespec ts = detail::timepoint_to_timespec(my_abs);
00234 
00235                 auto ret = pmemobj_mutex_timedlock(pop, &this->plock, &ts);
00236 
00237                 if (ret == 0)
00238                         return true;
00239                 else if (ret == ETIMEDOUT)
00240                         return false;
00241                 else
00242                         throw lock_error(ret, std::system_category(),
00243                                          "Failed to lock a mutex");
00244         }
00245 
00247         PMEMmutex plock;
00248 };
00249 
00250 } /* namespace obj */
00251 
00252 } /* namespace nvml */
00253 
00254 #endif /* PMEMOBJ_TIMED_MUTEX_HPP */
